messages.msgSnippet: ... What you think of me is none of my business. ********************************************************* Tia Leschke   leschke@islandnet.com On Vancouver
messages.messageBody:
>The orange root vegetable answers:
>
>1. A ring of twenty-four karat gold.
>2. A two carat diamond.
>3. The rabbit ate the carrot.
>4. The mark ^ used to show where an addition is to be made in text, is a
>caret.
>
>Interesting. I never noticed that diamond carats were spelled differently
>than gold karats.

What you think of me is none of my business.
*********************************************************
Tia Leschke leschke@...
On Vancouver Island

messages.subject: re: spelling
messages.msgSnippet: The orange root vegetable answers: 1. A ring of twenty-four karat gold. 2. A two carat diamond. 3. The rabbit ate the  carrot. 4. The mark ^ used to show where
messages.messageBody:
The orange root vegetable answers:

1. A ring of twenty-four karat gold.
2. A two carat diamond.
3. The rabbit ate the carrot.
4. The mark ^ used to show where an addition is to be made in text, is a
caret.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
